CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "John Redman, 1415 Wylie Avenue, Schutte's Bar and Grill, Wylie Avenue near Townsend Street. 'Yes, providing that the White Bartenders' Association will accept them as full-fledged bartender and not as waiters, bell-hops and porters.  I would like to issue a statement to the paper regarding the situation.'"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender John Redman posed holding cigarette behind bar, with cash register and Carstairs White Seal sign reading "Our ceiling prices...," in background, in Schutte's Bar and Grill, Wylie Avenue near Townsend Street
